summary:
This mod is for everyone that uses realism mods to enhance gameplay and adds to that making time pass when performing actions like reading, eating, crafting and training.
Each menu has separate time and activation options.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://static-1.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/40952-1-1394642166.png[/img][/center]
This mod is for everyone that uses realism mods to enhance gameplay and adds to that making time pass when performing actions like reading, eating, crafting and training, you can use the MCM menu to set every option as you prefer and customize your game experience.

Main features:

- Calculates the time spent in various menus in the game and forwards the game time accordingly
- Each module can be activated or deactivated separately using the MCM reducing the scripts running
- Each module has different options to activate or deactivate features
- Time spent for different actions like crafting, eating, training and leveling can be set using the MCM
- Time spent in menus is calculated using the current game time scale and a time multiplier set in MCM
- Optional block for certain actions during combat like opening inventory, reading and looting
- Reading increases speech based on time spent reading
- Expertise in the appropriate skill reduces the time needed to perform actions
- FISS support to save and load settings

Use posts, any suggestion and criticism is well accepted!

Translations:

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/58039/?]French[/url] by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/6376874/?]Floyd2099

[/url][center][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/6376874/?][/url][url=http://www.skyrimgems.com][img]http://i.imgur.com/sSbds.png[/img][/url][/center]

[center][img]http://static-4.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/40952-3-1381877974.png[/img][/center]
Download and activate using NMM.

[center][img]http://static-4.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/40952-1-1394642439.png[/img][/center]
Updating from 2.x.x:

- Download the new file using NMM
- Activate and and click yes when asked to update

Updating from 1.2.0:

- Use the MCM page and deactivate the mod, save the game and exit
- Deactivate the mod using NMM
- Load the game and make a new save then exit
- Download the new file and activate using NMM
- Load the new save and wait for the MCM menu message, save the game and play

[center][img]http://static-4.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/40952-1-1381878016.png[/img][/center]
Use the MCM page and deactivate the mod, save the game then deactivate and remove using NMM.

[center][img]http://static-4.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/40952-5-1381877974.png[/img][/center]
This mod requires skse and SkyUI.

[center][img]http://static-4.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/40952-2-1381877974.png[/img][/center]
The mod is compatible with all books, food, armors and weapons from all DLCs and mods.
For the crafting module, weapons and armors from mods will fall into the right category if the mods author has set the right keywords for the item, otherwise it will fall into the armor timing for armors or ammo timing for weapons.
Works with mods that change the timescale.

Recommended Mods for increased immersion:
- Frostfall
- iNeed / Realistic Needs and Diseases
- Hunterborn
- Skyrim - Enhanced Camera /Â Immersive First Person
- Immersive HUD
- Loot and Degradation

[center][img]http://static-2.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/40952-1-1395154222.png[/img][/center]
Q: I have installed the mod and now i can't use the ESC menu, what can i do?
A: The ESC menu is actually the Journal menu so if you have the "block journal during combat" option active you won't be able to use it when in combat, if you just updated and want to set the mod find somewhere safe and wait a bit to exit combat, now you can use the menu as normal, note that time will be calculated and forwarded when you close the menu, you can remove this using the MCM.

Q: What can i use to pause the game now that i have all options active?
A: The Tween menu opened with the TAB key, the Favorite menu opened pressing Q and the Console are safe for pausing the game, time never gets calculated in this menus.

Q: I only want the Block action during combat feature but not the time forward, what can i do?
A: You can activate the module you want and set the time multiplier to 0, this way time won't pass but you'll still have the block in combat function.

Q: I have installed XYZ armor/weapon mod, but when i craft the pieces, the time is not calculated correctly, why?
A: The mod uses item keywords to identify what kind of item you are crafting and if it doesn't match it will default to armor timings in case of armor pieces or to ammo timings for weapons, there is no way for me to fix this so ask the mod author to include the correct keywords for each piece.

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/2192278/?tb=mods&pUp=1][center][img]http://static-4.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/40952-2-1381878017.png[/img][/center][/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/2192278/?tb=mods&pUp=1]Check out my other mods.[/url]
author: Akezhar

files.name: Reading Takes Time
files.changelogHtml: Fixed a bug where the mod would stop working after reloading a save.

files.name: Living Takes Time
files.changelogHtml:
added crafting module
added looting module
added training module
added preparing module
added trading module

files.name: Living Takes Time
files.changelogHtml:
added home image in MCM
fixed a bug that was opening the tween menu after closing a menu during combat
fixed a menu entry that was showing the wrong value
"can't do that" message is now not shown if the show notification option is disabled

files.name: Living Takes Time
files.changelogHtml:
added separated options for crafting times of different armor pieces and weapon types
added support for smelting, tanning and misc items
fixed a bug that would advance the time incorrectly after reading for people with inventory module disabled
time is now correctly calculated for eating even if food is hotkeyed

files.name: Living Takes Time
files.changelogHtml:
added time reduction based on skill level
added speech increase from reading books
fixed incompatibility with mods that added items to the player inventory when opening crafting stations

files.name: Living Takes Time
files.changelogHtml:
added support for FISS, you can now save your settings and load them for different characters/computers
added a separate time multiplier for pickpocketing

files.name: Living Takes Time
files.changelogHtml:
added translation support
added time spent when learning a spell

files.name: Living Takes Time
files.changelogHtml:
fixed a bug that was causing time forward when selling spell books
improved compatibility with Frostfall, Soothe spell doesn't forward time anymore
the mod is now disabled by default
